notes.text: Updated cfme packages that fix several bugs, and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat CloudForms 3.2.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat CloudForms Management Engine delivers the insight, control, and
automation needed to address the challenges of managing virtual
environments. CloudForms Management Engine is built on Ruby on Rails, a
model-view-controller (MVC) framework for web application development.
Action Pack implements the controller and the view components.

This update also fixes several bugs and adds various enhancements.
Documentation for these changes is available in the Release Notes and Technical Notes documents linked to in the References section.

All cfme users are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which
correct these issues and add these enhancements.
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

notes.text: Multiple format string vulnerabilities in log_subscriber.rb files in the log subscriber component in Action Mailer in Ruby on Rails 3.x before 3.2.15 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted e-mail address that is improperly handled during construction of a log message.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: email address processing DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

This issue did not affect the versions of rubygem-actionmailer as shipped with Red Hat Subscription Asset Manager 1 as they do not include support for sending email using user supplied addresses.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

https://access.redhat.com/articles/

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in exceptions.rb in the i18n gem before 0.6.6 for Ruby allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted I18n::MissingTranslationData.new call.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2013-4492 rubygem-i18n: cross-site scripting flaw in exception handling
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2013-4492 rubygem-i18n: cross-site scripting flaw in exception handling

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in server.rb in Sprockets before 2.0.5, 2.1.x before 2.1.4, 2.2.x before 2.2.3, 2.3.x before 2.3.3, 2.4.x before 2.4.6, 2.5.x before 2.5.1, 2.6.x and 2.7.x before 2.7.1, 2.8.x before 2.8.3, 2.9.x before 2.9.4, 2.10.x before 2.10.2, 2.11.x before 2.11.3, 2.12.x before 2.12.3, and 3.x before 3.0.0.beta.3, as distributed with Ruby on Rails 3.x and 4.x, allow remote attackers to determine the existence of files outside the application root via a ../ (dot dot slash) sequence with (1) double slashes or (2) URL encoding.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: arbitrary file existence disclosure
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

notes.text: REST client for Ruby (aka rest-client) before 1.8.0 allows remote attackers to conduct session fixation attacks or obtain sensitive cookie information by leveraging passage of cookies set in a response to a redirect.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2015-1820 rubygem-rest-client: session fixation vulnerability Set-Cookie headers present in an HTTP 30x redirection responses
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/articles/

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2015-1820 rubygem-rest-client: session fixation vulnerability Set-Cookie headers present in an HTTP 30x redirection responses

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

notes.text: REST client for Ruby (aka rest-client) before 1.7.3 logs usernames and passwords, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading the log.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2015-3448 rubygem-rest-client: unsanitized application logging
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/articles/

The permissions on log files can be changed, e.g. using "chmod o-rwx" to prevent anyone but the user and group owner of the file from reading it. Additionally the group permissions can also be removed, e.g. "chmod g-rwx" if only the user owning the file should be able to see it.
